info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 11 at 8:53AM MST until October 11 at 11:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The Agua Fria River basin in Yavapai County.
* WHEN...Until 1145 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 AM MST, river gages on the Agua Fria indicate 2 to 3 foot rises near Cordes Lakes from rainfall overnight and this morning. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area and additional river level rises are possible in the next 2 hours. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Black Canyon Creek, Government Spring Wash, Little Ash Creek, Tank Creek, Indian Creek, Antelope Creek, Sycamore Creek, Squaw Creek, Copper Creek, Agua Fria River, Larry Creek, Bishop Creek, North Fork Rock Creek, Dry Creek, Big Bug Creek, Little Sycamore Creek, Badger Spring Wash, Ash Creek, Rock Creek, Slate Creek, Castle Creek, Silver Creek, Turkey Creek and Black Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Agua Fria National Monument, Sunset Point Rest Area, Cordes Lakes, Black Canyon City, Bumble Bee, Cordes Junction, Arcosanti, Dugas, Rock Springs and Castle Creek Wilderness. - This includes the following highways... State Route 69 near mile marker 263. Interstate 17 between mile markers 242 and 264.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Black Canyon Campground. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR THE AGUA FRIA RIVER IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM MST THIS MORNING
